doc.name: mobileControlGet
doc.summary: Gets the value of a property of a native mobile control created using mobileControlCreate.

history.changed: Changed iphoneControlGet -> mobileControlGet and added Android browser support
Added support for Multi-line Native Text Field

description.overview: Use the mobileControlGet function to get the value of properties of a native mobile control created with mobileControlCreate.

parameter.name: idOrName
parameter.description: The id or name of the control.

option.description: Returns the id of the control where the name is passed.
Returns the name of the control where the id is passed.
Returns the bounds of the control, relative to the top-left of the card. For example "0,0,100,100".
Returns true if the control is visible.
Returns true if the control is accessible through Voice Over. Default value is false.
Returns true if the control is opaque.
Returns the blendlevel of the control as an integer between 0 and 255.
Returns the background color of the control as an integer between 0 to 255.
returns the currently loaded URL of the webview.
returns true if there is a next page in the history.
Returns true if there is a previous page in the history.
returns true if the page is scaled to fit the rect of the control
returns true | false
returns a comma delimited list of the types of data that are automatically converted to clickable URLs. None or more of the following:
returns true if the web-view allows media files to be played 'inline' in the page.
returns true if media files DO NOT play automatically in the webview. Note: This property is only available on iOS4.0 and later.
specifies whether or not the browser can be scrolled (boolean).
determines whether the scroller 'bounces' when it hits the edge of the contentRect.

returns the rectangle over which the scroller scrolls. This is distinct from the scroller's rect. The minimum/maximum values of the scroll properties (adjusted for the size of the scroller). This is a comma-separated list of four integers, describing a rectangle. For example "0,0,100,100".

returns the horizontal scroll offset. This is an integer value ranging between the left and right of the contentRect, adjusting appropriately for the size of the scroller (i.e. contentRect.left to contentRect.right - rect.width).

returns the vertical scroll offset. This is an integer value ranging between the top and bottom of the contentRect, adjusting appropriately for the size of the scroller (i.e. contentRect.top to contentRect.bottom - rect.height).
returns true if the scroller is monitoring a touch for the start of a scroll action (maps to the UIScrollView tracking property).
returns true if the scroller is currently performing a scroll action (maps to the UIScrollView dragging property).
returns true if touches on the scroller cause scrolling (maps to the UIScrollView scrollEnabled property).
returns true if the horizontal indicator should be displayed when scrolling (maps to the UIScrollView showsHorizontalScrollIndicator property).
returns true if the vertical indicator should be displayed when scrolling (maps to the UIScrollView showsVerticalScrollIndicator property).
returns true if the scroller bounces when it hits the edge of the contentRect (maps to the UIScrollView bounces property).
returns true if a touch on the status bar causes the scroll to scroll to the top (maps to the UIScrollView scrollsToTop property).

returns true if the scroller is allowed to cancel a touch that has been passed through to the underlying controls when it thinks it's a scroll gesture (maps to the UIScrollView canCancelContentTouches property).
returns true if the scroller delays passing on touch-down events until it has determined whether it is the start of a scroll gesture or not (maps to the UIScrollView delaysContentTouches property).
returns true if scrolling stops on multiples of the scroller's bounds (maps to the UIScrollView pagingEnabled property).
returns the rate at which scrolling decelerates when a finger is lifted (maps to the UIScrollView decelerationRate property). This can be either normal, fast or a real number.
returns the style of indicators to display (maps to the UIScrollView indicatorStyle property). One of the following:

returns how far from the edge of the scroller's bounds, the indicators are inset (maps to the UIScrollView scrollIndicatorInsets property). This is a comma-separated list of four integers, describing the left, top, right and bottom inset distances. For example "0,0,100,100".
returns true if scrolling is locked to the initial direction a drag occurs in (maps to the UIScrollView directionalLockEnabled property).
returns true if the scroll is currently decelerating after a scroll action (maps to the UIScrollView decelerating property).
returns the filename or URL of the media set on the player, if any.
returns true if the controller is displayed over the content.
returns the current position of the playhead, measured in milliseconds (maps to the native currentPlaybackTime property). This is an integer value.
returns true if the playback of the movie loops indefinitely.
returns true if the player's content is set to play fullscreen.
returns true if the player's content should preserve its aspect ratio when scaled to fit within the control's bounds.
returns true if the movie uses a system-supplied audio session or not (maps to the native useApplicationAudioSession property).
returns true if the playback of network-based content begins automatically when there is enough buffered data to ensure uninterrupted playback (maps to the native shouldAutoplay property).

returns true if a control is presented to allow the user to choose AirPlay-enabled hardware for playback (maps to the native allowsAirPlay property). Note: This property is only supported on iOS 4.3 and later.
returns the duration of a movie, measured in milliseconds (maps to the native duration property). This is an integer value.
returns the amount of currently playable content, measured in milliseconds (maps to the native playableDuration property). This is an integer value.
returns the position at which playback starts, measured in milliseconds (maps to the native initialPlaybackTime property). This is an integer value.
returns the position at which playback ends, measured in milliseconds (maps to the native endPlaybackTime property). This is an integer value.

returns the current playback rate for the player (maps to the native currentPlaybackRate property). This represents a multiplier for the default playback rate of the current content. A value of 0.0 indicates playback is stopped, while a value of 1.0 indicates normal speed. Positive values indicate forward playback, while negative values indicate reverse playback. This is real value.
returns the network load state of the player (maps to the native loadStateproperty). This is a comma delimited list of zero or more of the following:

value.name: playable
value.description: enough data is available to start playing, but it may run out before playback finishes.

value.name: playthrough
value.description: enough data has been buffered for playback to continue uninterrupted.

value.name: stalled
value.description: buffer of data has stalled and playback may pause automatically if the player runs out of data.

option.description: returns the current playback state of the player (maps to the native playbackState property). This is one of the following:

value.name: stopped
value.description: playback is stopped and commences from the beginning when started.

value.name: paused
value.description: playback is paused and resumes from the point it was paused.

value.name: interrupted
value.description: playback is temporarily interrupted, perhaps because the buffer ran out of content.

value.name: seeking forward
value.description: the player is currently seeking towards the end of the movie.

value.name: seeking backward
value.description: the player is currently seeking towards the beginning of the movie.

option.description: The raw size of a video frame in pixels (maps to the native naturalSize property). This is a comma-separated list of two integers, the first is the width, the second is the height.
returns the content of the control (maps to the native text property). This is a string value.
returns the content of control encoded as UTF-16 (maps to the native text property). This is a binary value.

returns the color used for the text in control (maps to the native textColor property). This is either a standard color name, or a string of the form red,green,blue or red,green,blue,alpha. Where the components are integers in the range 0 to 255.
returns the name of the font used for text in the control. This is a string value.
returns the size of the font used for text in the control. This is an integer value.
returns the alignment used for text in the control (maps to the native textAlignment property). One of:

returns true if the size of the text is scaled so that it fits within the width of the control down to the size specified by the minimumFontSize property (maps to the native adjustsFontSizeToFitWidth property).
returns the minimum size text is shrunk to satisfy autoFit requirements (maps to the native minimumFontSize property). This is an integer value.
returns true if the control is emptied automatically when editing begins (maps to the native clearsOnBeginEditing property). This is a boolean.
returns the display mode of the standard 'clear' button overlay (maps to the native clearButtonMode property). This is one of the following:

value.name: while editing
value.description: only display the clear button while editing

value.name: unless editing
value.description: only display the clear button when not editing

option.description: returns the type of border around the control (maps to the native borderStyle property). This is one of the following:

value.name: line
value.description: draw a thin line around the control

value.name: bezel
value.description: draw a bezel-style border around the control

value.name: rounded
value.description: draw a rounded rectangle style border around the control

option.description: returns true if control is currently being edited (maps to the native editing property). This is a boolean value.
returns when the shift-key is automatically enabled (maps to the native autocapitalizationType property). This is one of the following:

value.name: none
value.description: the shift-key is never automatically enabled

value.name: words
value.description: the shift-key is enabled at the start of words

value.name: sentences
value.description: the shift-key is enabled at the start of sentences

value.name: all characters
value.description: the shift-key is enabled at the start of each character

option.description: returns whether auto-correct behavior is enabled (maps to the native autocorrectionType property). This is one of the following:

value.name: default
value.description: use the appropriate auto-correct behavior for the current script system

option.description: returns true if the return key is automatically enabled or disabled based on whether the control has content or not (maps to the native enablesReturnKeyAutomatically property). This is a boolean value.
returns what kind of appearance the keyboard has (maps to the native keyboardAppearance property). This is one of the following:

value.name: alert
value.description: the keyboard that is suitable for an alert panel (iPhone/iPod only)

option.description: returns what kind of keyboard is displayed (maps to the native keyboardType property). This is one of the following:
returns what kind of return-key the keyboard has (maps to the native returnKeyType property). This is one of the following:
returns what kind of content the control contains. This is one of the following:

value.name: password
value.description: plain text displayed in the standard iOS password style

option.description: Determines whether the control is enabled or not. This is a boolean value.
Determines whether the control can contain multiple lines of text or not. This is a boolean value.
returns the content of the control (maps to the native text property). This is a string value.
returns the content of control encoded as UTF-16 (maps to the native text property). This is a binary value.

returns the color used for the text in control (maps to the native textColor property). This is either a standard color name, or a string of the form red,green,blue or red,green,blue,alpha. Where the components are integers in the range 0 to 255.
returns the name of the font used for text in the control. This is a string value.
returns the size of the font used for text in the control. This is an integer value.
returns the alignment used for text in the control (maps to the native textAlignment property). One of:
returns true if control is currently being edited (maps to the native editing property). This is a boolean value.
returns when the shift-key is automatically enabled (maps to the native autocapitalizationType property). This is one of the following:

value.name: none
value.description: the shift-key is never automatically enabled

value.name: words
value.description: the shift-key is enabled at the start of words

value.name: sentences
value.description: the shift-key is enabled at the start of sentences

value.name: all characters
value.description: the shift-key is enabled at the start of each character

option.description: returns whether auto-correct behavior is enabled (maps to the native autocorrectionType property). This is one of the following:

value.name: default
value.description: use the appropriate auto-correct behavior for the current script system

option.description: returns true if the return key is automatically enabled or disabled based on whether the control has content or not (maps to the native enablesReturnKeyAutomatically property). This is a boolean value.
returns what kind of appearance the keyboard has (maps to the native keyboardAppearance property). This is one of the following:

value.name: alert
value.description: the keyboard that is suitable for an alert panel (iPhone/iPod only)

option.description: returns what kind of keyboard is displayed (maps to the native keyboardType property). This is one of the following:
returns what kind of return-key the keyboard has (maps to the native returnKeyType property). This is one of the following:
returns what kind of content the control contains. This is one of the following:

value.name: password
value.description: plain text displayed in the standard iOS password style

option.description: returns whether the text field can be edited. This is one of the following:

value.name: false
value.description: the text field cannot be edited

value.name: true
value.description: the text field can be edited

option.description: returns a comma delimited list of the types of data that are automatically converted to clickable URLs. This is none or more of the following:
returns the start index and the length of the text selected in a text field.

returns the rectangle over which the scroller scrolls. This is distinct from the scroller's rect. The minimum/maximum values of the scroll properties (adjusted for the size of the scroller). This is a comma-separated list of four integers, describing a rectangle. For example "0,0,100,100".

returns the horizontal scroll offset. This is an integer value ranging between the left and right of the contentRect, adjusting appropriately for the size of the scroller (i.e. contentRect.left to contentRect.right - rect.width).

returns the vertical scroll offset. This is an integer value ranging between the top and bottom of the contentRect, adjusting appropriately for the size of the scroller (i.e. contentRect.top to contentRect.bottom - rect.height).
returns true if the scroller bounces when it hits the edge of the contentRect (maps to the UIScrollView bounces property).
returns true if a touch on the status bar causes the scroll to scroll to the top (maps to the UIScrollView scrollsToTop property).

returns true if the scroller is allowed to cancel a touch that has been passed through to the underlying controls when it thinks it's a scroll gesture (maps to the UIScrollView canCancelContentTouches property).
returns true if the scroller delays passing on touch-down events until it has determined whether it is the start of a scroll gesture or not (maps to the UIScrollView delaysContentTouches property).
returns true if scrolling stops on multiples of the scroller's bounds (maps to the UIScrollView pagingEnabled property).
returns the rate at which scrolling decelerates when a finger is lifted (maps to the UIScrollView decelerationRate property). This can be either normal, fast or a real number.
returns the style of indicators to display (maps to the UIScrollView indicatorStyle property). One of the following:

returns how far from the edge of the scroller's bounds, the indicators are inset (maps to the UIScrollView scrollIndicatorInsets property). This is a comma-separated list of four integers, describing the left, top, right and bottom inset distances. For example "0,0,100,100".
returns true if touches on the scroller cause scrolling (maps to the UIScrollView scrollEnabled property).
returns true if the horizontal indicator should be displayed when scrolling (maps to the UIScrollView showsHorizontalScrollIndicator property).
returns true if the vertical indicator should be displayed when scrolling (maps to the UIScrollView showsVerticalScrollIndicator property).
returns true if scrolling is locked to the initial direction a drag occurs in (maps to the UIScrollView directionalLockEnabled property).
returns true if the scroller is monitoring a touch for the start of a scroll action (maps to the UIScrollView tracking property).
returns true if the scroller is currently performing a scroll action (maps to the UIScrollView dragging property).
returns true if the scroll is currently decelerating after a scroll action (maps to the UIScrollView decelerating property).
Determines whether the control can contain multiple lines of text or not. This is a boolean value.
Determines whether the control is enabled or not. This is a boolean value.
